column1: # We need to define a Poller and then one or more References for that poller.
# The Poller will 'poll' the device and bring back 1 or more registers/bits.
# The References must then match up with the polled range to define the topic for each.
# device_name: any string without spaces to describe the device
# start_address: integer 0 to 65535 (The start address of Modbus registers to poll)
# size: integer 0 to 65535 (No. of registers to poll and value must not exceed the limits of Modbus)
# endian: to describe byte_order and word_order e.g. BE_BE/BE_LE/LE_LE/LE_BE
# name: any string without spaces to describe the reference
# unit (optional): the measurement unit of reference
# address: integer 0 to 65535 (the modbus address and should match the poller range)
# rw: read write setting e.g. r/w/rw
# scale (optional): float value to be multiplied with actual reading
